name: rngogcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))

stmt.origin: syl3an1(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2), wcel(c4, cgr))
stmt.pretty: syl3an1(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, (c1[c4]c3)∈ c2, c4 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))
-| wi(w3a(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)→(c1[c4]c3)∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c4 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c4 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)→(c1[c4]c3)∈ c2)

⊣ ((c4 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)→(c1[c4]c3)∈ c2)

comment: Closure law for the addition (group) operation of a ring. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 9-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
